summary: The BMW N42 is a four-cylinder engine produced from 2001 to 2004, with displacements of 1.8 L and 2.0 L. It features an inline-4 layout, DOHC valvetrain with variable valve timing (VVT) and variable valve lift (VVL), and is made of aluminum. The N42B18 variant won the 1.4-1.8 L category at the International Engine of the Year awards in 2001. In 2004, it was succeeded by the BMW N46 engine. The smaller N40 engine, also produced from 2001 to 2004, has a displacement of 1.6 L and lacks Valvetronic. Both engines are petrol-powered and were preceded by the BMW M43 engine.
